incidents.name: Docker rate limit errors when using `fly deploy`

incident_updates.body: We've identified the root cause for this issue and are implementing mitigations.

We are investigating sporadic build failures mentioning Docker rate limits on "unauthenticated pulls" and error 429.

In the meantime, workarounds to try in order are:
1. Use `fly deploy --depot=false`
2. Use `fly deploy --buildkit`
3. Install Docker locally and use `--local-only` with Fly deploy

incidents.name: Network Issues in FRA, GRU, SCL, and SIN

incident_updates.body:
We've identified and mitigated a Fly Proxy issue affecting hosts on the FRA, GRU, SCL, and SIN regions. Network connectivity has been fully restored and all services have returned to normal. 

Affected Hosts on the regions experienced connectivity issues for 1 hour and 10 minutes ( 12:30 - 13:40 UTC ).

This incident has been resolved.
This incident has been resolved.
Traffic has been rerouted to all affected regions. We will continue to monitor network performance.
We are continuing to address networking issues affecting traffic between the USA and some European regions.
We are working with our upstream providers to establish alternate network paths.
We are working with our upstream providers to resolve this issue.
We are investigating reports of network issues across various regions, mainly EU/NA. Apps are still running, but may experience packet loss or higher latency.
This incident has been resolved.
One of our upstream providers is having network connectivity issues in EWR. You may experience increased latency, packet loss, or total connectivity failure while they investigate the issue.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We've identified an issue with our state replication system and are working on a fix.
We are investigating an issue with fly.dev domain DNS resolution. Default fly.dev domains for apps may fail to resolve. Custom domains continue to work.

incidents.name: Some billing operations failing to synchronize

incident_updates.body: Everything is working normally and billing tasks have run to completion and stabilized.
We've fixed the issue and are monitoring normalization while DNS records propagate and pending processes run to completion.
Due to a DNS issue (it's always DNS, isn't it?), some billing-related operations are going unprocessed. This affects mainly registration of payment methods. Usage metering is not affected.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are investigating network issues in HKG region.

incidents.name: Name resolution for Fly Consul cluster degraded

incident_updates.body: This incident is resolved and services depending on Consul should be working correctly now.

DNS has been restablished and services depending on Consul should start recovering, though due to DNS caching behavior this may take a few minutes to propagate. We are monitoring the situation to ensure full recovery.

DNS for the Fly Consul cluster is currently degraded. This primarily affects unmanaged Postgres clusters. We are working on restoring DNS operation for this domain. This DNS degradation does not affect any other user-facing components and should not affect running machines, apps or any APIs.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results
We are seeing intermittent networking issues on some nodes in IAD
This incident has been resolved.
The upstream provider is working to recover the WireGuard server in IAD region. We will provide further updates as available.
Due to an issue with an upstream provider, 6PN WireGuard peers are currently not able to connect in IAD region. We are working with the upstream provider to resolve this issue.

Due to issues with an upstream internet backbone provider, we saw elevated rates of packet loss across our network between  14:15 - 14:35 UTC. 
This has been resolved and networking is working as expected.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are working with our upstream providers to establish an alternate network path.
We are working with our upstream providers to establish an alternate network path.
This incident has been resolved.

A fix has been implemented  and log search in the fly-metrics.net Grafana dashboard is working normally. 

We're continuing to monitor to ensure full recovery.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are investigating issues loading the searchable app logs in the fly-metrics.net Grafana dashboard. 

Users may see a 500 error loading logs for some apps. Viewing logs in your app's Fly Dashboard page or via the `flyctl logs` command is working as normal.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are experiencing network issues in ORD. Some destinations are unreachable. We are working with our upstream providers to fix it ASAP.

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved and all MPG clusters in ORD are operating as expected. 

During this incident a small number of clusters in ORD would have seen degraded or failing connections when using the PGBouncer connection pooler URL to connect to their database.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are currently investigating a host issue resulting in a small number of MPG clusters in ORD to be in degraded status. If you're having trouble connecting to your database, please get in touch via the support portal.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

We have identified an issue with our GraphQL API server and are working to resolve this issue. Most Machines API endpoints are functioning at this time. Creating new machines/volumes, as well as updating machines, will still fail.
We are investigating an issue with our primary database. Machines API and GraphQL calls may fail at this time, and the dashboard may be unavailable. Apps continue to run.
This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results
We are currently investigating elevated 503 and 404 errors from the Machine API.
This incident has been resolved.
We are investigating API issues related to our database instance. Dashboard pages may fail to load, and GraphQL / Machines API queries may fail.
This incident has been resolved.
Traffic across North America has been shifted to alternative upstreams and packet loss metrics have returned to nominal values. We are monitoring for any further issues.

We are currently experiencing network issues related to an upstream provider, causing high packet loss to certain destinations. We are working to shift traffic away from the impacted provider.

This affects mainly the IAD region but may also impact other regions. Impacted apps will continue to run, may experience degraded public and private network connectivity at this time.

incident_updates.body:
We're investigating IPv6 connectivity issues on a small number of hosts in the SJC region. Machines on impacted hosts may see inbound/outbound connectivity issues over IPv6. IPv4 connections for these hosts are not impacted. 

The majority of hosts in SJC continue to see normal IPv6 performance. Users seeing issues can re-create impacted machines in SJC or nearby regions by following the steps outlined here: https://fly.io/docs/apps/trouble-host-unavailable/

components.name: Deployments

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented on all hosts in AMS and we are seeing networking return to normal in the region. We are continuing to monitor networking in the region to ensure stability.

The issue has been identified and an initial fix has been deployed. We are seeing improvements on most hosts in the region, and are continuing to work on restoring the remaining impacted hosts. 
Apps with machines on impacted hosts may still experience network issues at this time.
We are investigating upstream network issues in AMS region. Apps may experience network issues.
This incident has been resolved.
We have completed rolling out the fix to all apps impacted by this issue. We are seeing "App Not Found" errors decrease. We are continuing to monitor to ensure stability.
We are continuing to roll out the fix for this issue to impacted apps and some users are seeing operations return to normal. We will confirm once the roll out is fully complete.

We are seeing elevated rates of "App not found" errors impacting some apps. Users may see these errors when interacting with impacted apps via the Machines API, Flyctl, or their dashboard. 

We have identified the cause of these errors and are working on a fix.
All systems are now operating normally. Well continue to monitor closely, but no further impact is expected.
The reseeding process is complete and API responses are back to normal. We continue to monitor the system to ensure everything remains healthy.
We're making progress with reseeding our state store and are now working on speeding up the reseed process overall. Users may continue to see inconsistencies with our API.
We're continuing to investigate this issue.
We've started a rollout to our global state store and are noticing degraded performance for our API. Users may see inconsistent data related to their machines.
We're seeing a higher number of 500s when calling the Machines API or when trying to launch a machine.

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved. Networking in SJC has remained stable over the past two hours. 

This was caused by a dark fiber maintenance, which had a larger-than-anticipated impact.
As a result, some transport capacity was lost, leading to packet loss to and from our servers.

incident_updates.body:
This incident has been resolved. Networking in IAD has remained stable over the past two hours. 

This was caused by a routing issue with an upstream networking provider that impacted connectivity to some hosts in IAD. We applied a change to work around the bad routing, and the underlying issue that caused this in the first place has been identified and fixed.

A fix has been applied to all impacted IAD hosts and networking performance in the region has returned to normal. 

Fly Managed Postgres clusters in IAD should all now be reachable, as well as Phoenix.new IDEs and preview sites. 

We are continuing to closely monitor networking performance in the region to ensure stability and full recovery.
We are continuing to work on implementing the fix to the impacted hosts in IAD.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

We are continuing to investigate this issue. Connectivity between a number of hosts in the IAD region is degraded. 

Customers will see inbound and outbound issues connecting to and from machines on impacted hosts. 

Some Fly Managed Postgres clusters are impacted by this, users may see additional latency or failures connecting to clusters in IAD.

Some users will see 500 errors accessing Phoenix.new IDEs and preview sites at this time.
We are currently investigating networking issues in IAD. Customers may see higher latency and elevated packet loss connecting to machines in this region.

incidents.name: Managed Postgres - Connectivity errors in IAD

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We've implemented a fix and are seeing the number of connection errors decrease. We're continuing to monitor to ensure full recovery.
We are currently investigating elevated connectivity errors between our  control plane and a small number of Managed Postgres clusters in IAD.
This incident has been resolved.
The database has recovered from its load spike and error rates have returned to normal levels.
We're investigating elevated database load causing timeouts and elevated 500 error rates on the Fly.io Dashboard and the GraphQL API.
